SENT.plain: Patients undergoing liver transplantation are predisposed to develop extrahepatic malignancies
It is also known that patients with predisposed conditions, such as Barrett's esophagus, have higher rates of esophageal carcinoma
We present here a patient who underwent liver transplantation, had Barrett's esophagus, and developed esophageal malignancy a short time after transplantation
Liver transplantation may be associated with acceleration of the precancerous condition and the development of malignancies
